awd_titl_txt: Research Initiation:  Transition To Turbulence In Models Of Breathing
awd_abstract_narration: The eventual goal of this project is to                                         describe the flow of gases through the lung.                                    The specific objective of the proposed                                          research is to characterize experimentally                                      the axial and secondary flows in a model of                                     bifurcating tubes that is dynamically similar                                   to the human airways.  The flows will be                                        determined using laser-Doppler velocimetry at                                   frequencies of normal breathing and also at                                     frequencies used for high-frequency                                             ventilation.  This basic engineering research                                   is an important first step toward a                                             comprehensive description of flows in the                                       entire lung.  Such a description will lead to                                   improved basic understanding, and eventually                                    should also result in improved diagnostic and                                   therapeutic procedures.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE ADMINISTRATORS OF TULANE EDUCATIONAL FUND
